intro: Urticastrum alatipes, commonly known as the winged spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and disturbed areas. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a distinctive wing-like appearance on the petioles. Urticastrum alatipes produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are surrounded by specialized bracts.
